dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, B, have you seen the latest news about Mark Zuckerberg and his, uh, philanthropic endeavors? He just made another huge donation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, B, have you seen the latest news about Mark Zuckerberg and his, uh, philanthropic endeavors? He just made another huge donation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Zuckerberg has donated to Silicon Valley Community Foundation (known as SVCF) in the past. The new gift brings his total giving to the foundation to slightly more than $1.96 billion, all of it in the form of Facebook stock.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! Another $214 million, this time through the Chan Zuckerberg Initiative. And get this, it brings his total giving to SVCF to just under two billion dollars, all of it in Facebook stock, by the way.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! Another two hundred fourteen million dollars, this time through the Chan Zuckerberg Initiative. And get this, it brings his total giving to S V C F to just under two billion dollars, all of it in Facebook stock, by the way.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The new gift brings his total giving to the foundation to slightly more than $1.96 billion, all of it in the form of Facebook stock. Zuckerberg and his wife made their latest donation via the Chan Zuckerberg Initiative (known as CZI), their philanthropic, advocacy and impact investing entity. CZI confirmed the $214 million donation but declined to comment further.

dialogue_turns.text: Wow. Almost two billion. That's, that's wild. Especially, um, considering all the privacy scandals Facebook's been through. I mean, his net worth has actually gone *up* by billions since then, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's pretty wild. But it does show you the scale of money flowing into these organizations. And SVCF, it's, uh, it's a behemoth. I think it's the largest community foundation in the country by assets, like, over $13.5 billion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's pretty wild. But it does show you the scale of money flowing into these organizations. And S V C F, it's, uh, it's a behemoth. I think it's the largest community foundation in the country by assets, like, over thirteen point five billion dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While SVCF grew quietly, as of early 2018 it had more than $13.5 billion in assets under management, making it the largest community foundation in the country as measured by assets.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, right. And it's grown so much because of these huge donations from, you know, some of the world's wealthiest people. A lot of it through these donor-advised funds, too, which are kinda like a charitable bank account, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, right. And it's grown so much because of these huge donations from, you know, some of the world's wealthiest people. A lot of it through these donor-advised funds, too, which are kinda like a charitable bank account, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It grew thanks to large gifts -- hundreds of millions of dollars, in some cases -- from some of the worlds wealthiest people. ... Most people donate to SVCF using something called a donor-advised fund, which is like a charitable bank account that holds assets until the donor wants to disperse some or all of the money to a nonprofit.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, exactly. You get the tax deduction up front, and then you can advise where the money goes later. Super attractive for people with a big tax bill after, say, selling a company or an IPO. But, uh, speaking of SVCF, it hasn't all been smooth sailing for them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly. You get the tax deduction up front, and then you can advise where the money goes later. Super attractive for people with a big tax bill after, say, selling a company or an I P O. But, uh, speaking of S V C F, it hasn't all been smooth sailing for them.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Donors can deduct as much as 30% of adjusted gross income when contributing to a donor-advised fund, so they are particularly attractive in years when theres a big tax bill after, say, selling your company or selling shares in an IPO.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, no, absolutely not. There was that whole scandal with the former CEO, Emmett Carson, right? Forbes did that big investigation into his management style, like, high turnover and complaints about harassment.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, no, absolutely not. There was that whole scandal with the former C E O, Emmett Carson, right? Forbes did that big investigation into his management style, like, high turnover and complaints about harassment.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Forbes published an investigation in May detailing Carsons management style, the foundations high turnover rate and complaints about management by former employees as well as details about donations from tech powerhouses to the foundation...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it was pretty damning. An investigation confirmed that many allegations of harassing behavior were substantiated, and that SVCF "failed to provide a safe and inclusive workplace." He, uh, he ended up leaving, though they were a bit vague on whether he resigned or was fired.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it was pretty damning. An investigation confirmed that many allegations of harassing behavior were substantiated, and that S V C F failed to provide a safe and inclusive workplace. He, uh, he ended up leaving, though they were a bit vague on whether he resigned or was fired.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: When the investigation was completed in June, the foundation published the summary and said in a statement that many allegations from current and former employees were substantiated and that SVCF clearly failed to provide a safe and inclusive workplace environment for its employees. The foundation boards statement also said Carson would depart his employment at SVCF, without specifying whether Carson resigned or was fired, or whether he was paid a severance or not.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And it wasn't just him either. His number two, Mari Ellen Loijens, she'd already resigned months earlier over similar harassment allegations. So, you know, it's been a tough couple of years for them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it wasn't just him either. His number two, Mari Ellen Loijens, she'd already resigned months earlier over similar harassment allegations. So, you know, it's been a tough couple of years for them.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Carsons departure came two months after the foundations former number two executive, Mari Ellen Loijens, the chief business, development and brand officer, resigned after the Chronicle of Philanthropy published an article detailing allegations of Loijens harassing behavior.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. But now they have a new leader, Nicole Taylor. She's starting in December. She was previously at the Arizona State University Foundation, overseeing things like estate planning and foundation relations.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. But now they have a new leader, Nicole Taylor. She's starting in December. She was previously at the Arizona State University Foundation, overseeing things like estate planning and foundation relations.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The newly named CEO of SVCF is Nicole Taylor, who previously served as vice president of the Arizona State University Foundation, overseeing annual giving, estate and gift planning and foundation relations. She will begin her role in on December 19, according to the foundation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's right! I remember hearing about her. She's got deep roots in the Bay Area nonprofit scene too, I think. She was at Stanford and ran another youth-focused nonprofit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's right! I remember hearing about her. She's got deep roots in the Bay Area nonprofit scene too, I think. She was at Stanford and ran another youth-focused nonprofit.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Before working at the Arizona State University Foundation, Taylor was associate vice provost of student affairs and dean of community engagement and diversity at Stanford University, and served as president and CEO of Menlo Park, Calif.-based Thrive Foundation for Youth, a nonprofit focused on developing youth ages 10 to 18. ... 'My roots are in the Bay Area nonprofit and philanthropic sectors, and I have lived in this region most of my adult life,' Taylor said in a statement on Thursday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And she gave this great quote about the Bay Area being a "region of contrasts," where "deep social challenges are often masked by the high-profile innovation culture." She really seems to get it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And she gave this great quote about the Bay Area being a region of contrasts, where deep social challenges are often masked by the high-profile innovation culture. She really seems to get it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Silicon Valley is a region of contrasts, one in which deep social challenges are often masked by the high-profile innovation culture. There is important work to be done in partnership with our donors, our community organizations and our civic and business leaders.

dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Which is probably exactly what SVCF needs right now, you know? Someone to, like, come in and really focus on the mission and the community, especially after all that workplace turmoil.
